items.text: back of a length and angling into middle and leg, Mushfiq shuffles across off stump and knocks the ball into the square-leg region
items.shortText: Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: full on middle and leg, pushed up to mid-on
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: short, hits the top of the bat, defended in front of his feet
items.postText: Narayanan: "@Chaminda, rather this is more like Bangladesh that everyone knows"
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: savindhu: "This is more like the Thisara perera we used to know. Leaking runs when other bowlers are bowling brilliantly"
items.text: good length and outside off, driven off the front foot to extra cover
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, Mushfiq softens his grip and plays it to backward point
items.postText: Chathura Dharma: "Suranga Lakmal seems to be playing an important part when Sri Lanka do well considering recent performances, Kolkata test, Dharmasala ODI and now here"
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: back of a length and outside off, punched into the backward point region for one
items.postText: sital: "Calm down all the Srilankan fans (Incl. me), Still so many overs left. At recent times Srilanka cricket has also disappointed its fan. I hope they wont do that this time! fingers crossed!"
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: MD Islam: "It's 2 am in USA, keeping an eye every now and then while sleeping. Hope BD will come back."
items.text: back of a length, moves in after pitching but does not threaten off stump, left alone
items.postText:
Think this is Lakmal's last over in the first spell

Roshan: "Give couple more overs to Chameera as Perera releasing the pressure from other end by leaking runs."
items.shortText: Lakmal to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.preText: Time for wristspin: Sandakan. He has a slip in position
items.text: flighted on off stump, 78ks, defended back off the front foot

items.postText: 1.15pm Sri Lanka were outstanding with the ball and in the field in the early exchanges. Can they keep it up and keep Bangladesh under pressure. Join Nikhil Kalro to find out. eddie: "This BD innings has eerie similarities to the start of BD's chase against NZ in the Champion's Trophy. Tami

items.text: drifts down leg, was there some glove on that? Yes, there was. It's a drop, it's poor from Dickwella. Strays on the leg stump, Rahim gets a bit of glove on his flick, the ball flies to his left, but Dickwella gets a bit of glove on that, and then it races away to fine leg.
items.shortText: Perera to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run
